quote: Captain's log, Stardate 43125.2.   We are en route to Mintaka Three,   where a three-man Federation   anthropological field team has   been studying the inhabitants.
Our mission is to resupply the   outpost and repair their   malfunctioning reactor.
Report, Mister La Forge.
We've finished replicating the   parts they need.       What I don't understand is why   a three-man station needs a   reactor that can produce   four-point-two gigawatts.
That's enough to power a small   phaser bank, a subspace relay   station, or...
... a hologram generator. Right   -- a "duck blind."
The anthropologists are studying   an extended family of Mintakans   at close range... from a   camouflaged observation post.
According to Doctor Barron's   preliminary reports, the Mintakans   are proto-Vulcan humanoids at the   Bronze Age level. Quite peaceful   and highly rational.
Not surprising, considering how   closely their evolution has   paralleled Vulcan.
Captain, incoming transmission   from Mintaka Three.
On screen.
Barron to Enterprise. Our   temporary repairs have failed.   The reactor is now inoperative.
Do you have battery backup?
Three hours' worth at best.
Captain, if we increase to warp   seven we can be there in twenty-three   minutes.
Make it so.       We're on our way --
We've lost contact, sir.
Increase to warp nine.
Why did we have to come so early?
When the sun reaches its zenith,   I have to be ready to take the   measurements.
You'll be ready. You've read   the sundial hundreds of times.
Yes, father -- but never as the   appointed recordkeeper.
You're taking your duties quite   seriously. Your mother would have   been proud of you.
What is that?
scene: 8A   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: I don't know...
scene: 8A   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Keep work... Palmer... Warren...
The hologram generator is now   functional.
Or would be, if we had power...
Almost there...
Enterprise -- beam Martinez and   his patient directly to Sickbay.
scene: 10AA	EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Doctor --
scene: 10AA	EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Crusher to Enterprise. Medical   emergency. Two to beam directly   to Sickbay.
scene: 12   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: That should do it.
Before you start quoting the Prime   Directive -- he'd already seen   us; the damage was done. It was   bring him aboard or let him die.
Then why didn't you let him die?
Because we were responsible for   his injuries!
I don't know if I concur with   that reasoning, Doctor. But now   that he's here, you must remove   all memory of his encounter with   the away team.
By erasing short-term recall?
It's been accomplished before.
Yes, I'm familiar with Doctor   Pulaski's technique.       Though I can't guarantee it will   be effective on Mintakan brain   chemistry --
No! We must evacuate --
Doctor Barron! You're on the   Enterprise. You're safe now.
The others?
Doctor Warren is here. We're   doing all we can.
And Palmer? Where is Palmer?
Still on Mintaka Three.
Picard -- you have to find him.
We will.
He may be hurt --
Rest assured -- we will not leave   until we locate Palmer.
Thank you, Picard.
Picard to bridge. Report.
Scans of the planet detect no   humans, Captain.
Very well. Take us into a close   orbit.
Sir, a close orbit will   increase sensor efficiency by   only four percent.
I want that four percent,   Lieutenant.
Aye, sir.
Picard out.
Picard?
Damn --
Doctor, your next task is clear.
Oji?
scene: 28   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY

quote: Father?
scene: 28   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY

quote: Here...
scene: 29   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY

quote: I thought I'd never see you again.   When you and the woman vanished,   I was sure you were dead.
scene: 29   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY

quote: I think I was... but I was brought   back to life. I awoke in an   incredible place -- and my wounds   were gone. I had been healed.
scene: 29   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY

quote: How is that possible?
scene: 29   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY

quote: Long ago, our people believed in   beings with great powers. These   beings made the rains come, told   the sun when to rise, and caused   all life to be born, to grow,   to die.
scene: 29   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY

quote: But those are just tales -- old   superstitions.
scene: 29   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY

quote: Perhaps the beliefs of our   ancestors are true. Nothing else   can explain what's happened.       Everything's changed now, Oji.   We must tell the others...
scene: 29   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY

quote: ... Barron is stable, but Warren   is still critical.
Palmer is missing, and scans of   the planet pick up Mintakan life   forms only -- no humans.   However...

The area around the duck blind   exhibits Karst topography --   sinkholes, underground rivers,   and caverns. And the rock strata   contain a high concentration of   thallium compounds, which may be   obstructing our sensor beams.
So if Palmer, in his delirium,   fled into a cave, we might be   unable to detect his life signs.
Correct.
Captain, if he is still alive,   he probably needs medical   attention. We must send an away   team to locate him.
But our presence mustn't interfere   with the cultural development of   the Mintakans.
Agreed. Further contamination   must be prevented.
Sir, I have a suggestion.
First officer's log, Stardate   43125.3. Counselor Troi and I   are beaming down to Mintaka Three   to locate Doctor Palmer and   determine the extent of the   cultural contamination.
Doctor Crusher has temporarily   altered our features and skin   color. She's also implanted   subcutaneous communicators so that   any transmissions we receive will   be inaudible to the Mintakans.
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Riker to Enterprise -- do you   read?
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Perfectly, Commander. I will be   monitoring you continuously.
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Mintakan emotions are quite   interesting. Like the Vulcans,   they have highly ordered minds...   A very sensible people.
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: For example, Mintakan women   precede their mates. It's a   signal to other women.
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: "This man's taken; get your own?"
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Not precisely... More like, "if   you want his services, I'm the   one to negotiate with."
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: What kinds of "services?"
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: All kinds.
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Ah. They are a sensible race.
scene: 32   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - SECLUDED AREA - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I understand your skepticism.   Had it not happened to me, I would   find it difficult to accept as   well.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: But it did happen, just as we've   told you.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Fento -- you know the legends   better than anyone. Don't they   speak of beings like the ones I've   seen --
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: -- who could vanish like smoke?
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: There are the stories of the   Overseer... who could appear and   disappear at will...
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: And couldn't this Overseer heal   the dead?
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: He had supreme power -- or so our   ancestors believed.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: I believe I've seen the   Overseer...
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Uh-oh...
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: He is called the Picard.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: His memory is intact.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: The procedure didn't work.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Liko -- all this talk of a   supernatural being... No one's   believed that for countless   generations. Just as we no longer   believe the stars control our   fates, or that the spirits of the   dead haunt the living.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: I'm not saying all the old beliefs   are true. But I did see the   Picard, and I was restored to   life.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: We are visitors; we've come to   trade our cloth. May we speak?
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Please do -- we welcome outsiders.   I am Nuria.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: I am Troi; this is Riker.       You've had a very interesting   dream.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Dream? It was real!
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: My father and I both witnessed   these beings.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: If you are father and daughter,   you may have shared the same   dream.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: That is not reasonable.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Is it any less reasonable than   being magically propelled to a   strange place by "the Picard?"
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Nuria!
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: It has to be -- Palmer -- the one   the Picard wished to find.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Remarkable. You were speaking   the truth.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: The Picard will be pleased.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Riker to Picard.
scene: 33   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Go ahead, Number One.
We have a problem.
The contamination?
It's worse than we suspected.   The Mintakans are beginning to   believe in a god -- and the one   they've chosen... is you.
Picard -- you must beam Palmer   aboard immediately. Without   medical attention --
It's not that simple. He's   surrounded by Mintakans. If he   dematerializes before their   eyes...
... it will slightly increase the   cultural contamination which   already exists. A small price   for saving Palmer's life.
Number One -- is there any chance   of your freeing Palmer and   transporting up unseen?
We can try...
Try hard. Picard out.
Picard, I must protest. You're   endangering Palmer with this   delay.
I'm aware of that. But each of   us -- including Doctor Palmer --   took an oath to uphold the Prime   Directive... if necessary, with   our lives.
We followed a hornbuck into a   cave. The stranger was there --   asleep.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: This Palmer is one of the   Overseer's servants?
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Yes -- the Picard has many   servants.       Isn't that true?
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: According to the legends. But   if Palmer is a servant of the   Overseer, what was he doing in   the cave?
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Perhaps he ran away.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Or he failed the Picard somehow   and was hiding from him.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: We should bind him in case he   wakes and tries to escape.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: It's senseless to hold this   stranger captive. This Overseer   talk is nothing more than an old   superstition.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: I disagree. All the evidence   suggests the Overseer does exist.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: And I heard the Picard say he   wanted to find Palmer.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Then by keeping Palmer safe, we   will please the Picard.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: And he'll grant us favors in return.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Favors?
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: The Overseer was said to be   all-powerful. He could provide   gentle winters, plentiful hunting,   fertile crops... anything.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: He could even bring back those   who have died.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: We will keep Palmer for the   Picard.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: I've seen another one -- like   Palmer!
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Another servant of the Picard?
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: He's headed toward the caves!
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Fento -- stay and bind Palmer.
scene: 51   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Excuse me... that knot won't hold.   If I may assist...
scene: 54   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Please do.
scene: 54   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: The trick is to make a knot that   tightens under pressure. Here,   I'll show you...
scene: 54   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Father -- the sun's reaching its   zenith. If I don't go to measure...
Go.
Forgive me, friend... but the   stranger must be set free.
scene: 56   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Riker to Enterprise. Lock on and   prepare to beam us directly to   Sickbay, but wait for my signal.
scene: 57   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Acknowledged, Commander.
scene: 57   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Riker?
scene: 57   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Riker! Stop!
Oji?
It's Riker -- he's taking Palmer!
Yari -- don't let her escape.
I'm clear. Energize!
scene: 62   EXT. MINTAKA THREE - ANOTHER PATH - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Data. Has Counselor Troi beamed   up?
Negative, Commander. Sensors show   she's in the midst of a group of   Mintakans.
Damn.
Hali -- find Riker and Palmer.
scene: 65   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Why? Why did you and Riker take   Palmer from us?
scene: 65   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: We did not "take" Palmer...
scene: 65   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: ... we set him free. Riker and   I don't believe these fables about   the Overseer.
Don't you realize what you've   done?
You've angered the Picard -- and   we may all suffer for it!       Weren't there stories of the   Overseer destroying those who   offended him?
Stories. Nothing more.
Liko, we'll get Palmer back.   Riker was carrying him -- they   can't have gone far.
Still, the Picard may blame us   for Palmer's escape.       Perhaps we should punish her --   to let the Overseer know that she   and Riker acted alone.
We'll keep Troi captive.
That's not enough.
You would have us harm her?
If it will hold off the Picard's   anger -- yes. I've seen how   powerful he is...
I am unwilling to hurt Troi   needlessly.       We will wait for Hali and the   others to return.
And if they don't find Palmer?
Then we may have to do as Liko   suggests.
You believe the Mintakans are   capable of harming Troi?
They are not normally a violent   people... but these are   extraordinary circumstances.   They're trying to comprehend what   they believe to be a god.
Recommendations?
The Mintakans wish to please the   Overseer, but they can only guess   what he wants. They need a sign.
Are you suggesting...
You must go down to Mintaka Three.
Masquerading as a god?
Out of the question. The Prime   Directive --
Has already been violated. The   damage is done; all we can do now   is minimize it.
By sanctioning their false   beliefs?
By giving them guidelines...   letting them know what the   Overseer expects of them.
I cannot -- I will not impose a   set of commandments on these   people. To do so violates the   essence of the Prime Directive.
Like it or not, we've rekindled   the Mintakans' belief in the   Overseer.
And you're saying that belief will   eventually develop into a   religion.
It's inevitable. And without   guidance, that religion could   degenerate into inquisitions...   holy wars... chaos.

Your own reports describe how   rational these people are.   Millennia ago, they abandoned all   belief in the supernatural. And   now you're asking me to sabotage   that achievement... send them   back into the Dark Ages of fear   and superstition.       No. We must undo the damage we've   caused.       Number One -- tell me about the   group's leader.
Nuria is exceptionally fair-minded   and sensible... the Mintakans   trust her judgment. If we could   convince her we're not gods...
... she might be able to persuade   the others.
And how do you propose to convince   her?
She sees the Picard as a magical   figure. I'm going to show her   how the magic works.       Bring her aboard.
Counselor, sensors indicate five   Mintakans in your immediate   vicinity.
scene: 70   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Four are motionless; the fifth   is eight meters away, proceeding   south. Is Nuria one of these   five?
scene: 70   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Mmm-hmm.
scene: 70   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - DAY

quote: Was that intended to be an   affirmative?
Yes, Data, it was.
Is Nuria the closest of the five?
Mmm-mmm.
Negative.
Is Nuria the one in motion?
Mmm-hmm.
Lock sensors on Nuria.
Locked on, Commander. We can   beam Nuria aboard at will.
Data, when sensors indicate she's   alone, beam her to Transporter   Room One.
Aye, sir.
Ensign Hoy, I'll handle this.
Nuria -- don't be afraid.
No one's going to harm you.
Who... ?
My name is Jean-Luc Picard.
Please -- get up.
Get up! You don't kneel to me.
You do not wish it?
I do not deserve it.
Look at me. Feel the warmth of   my hand, the rhythm of my pulse.   I am not a supreme being -- I am   flesh and blood, like you.
Not like me...
Like you! Different in   appearance, yes. But we are both   living beings -- we are born, we   grow, we live, we die. In all   the ways that matter, we are   alike.
But -- you are the Picard!
Let me show you my people.       Let me show you something.
What a wondrous place this is.   Even the doors obey your commands.
It is wondrous -- but not   miraculous. The doors merely work   differently from the ones you   know.
That is my home?
Seen from far, far above.
Yet we don't fall.       I never imagined I would see the   clouds... from the other side.   Your powers are truly boundless.
Nuria -- your people live in huts.   Was it always so?
No. We have found remnants of   tools in caves. Our ancestors   must have lived there.
Why do you now live in huts?
Huts are better. Caves are dark   and wet --
If huts are better, why did your   people ever live in caves?
The most reasonable explanation   is that at one time we didn't know   how to make huts.
Just as there was a time when you   didn't know how to make cloth --   or bows.
That is reasonable.
Someone invented huts. Someone   invented the bow. And they taught   others, who taught their children,   who taught their children's   children...
Now suppose one of your cave-dwelling   ancestors could see you   as you are today. What would she   think?
I don't know.
Put yourself in her place. You   have a power she lacks. You can   kill a hornbuck from a great   distance.
Only because I have a bow.
She has never seen a bow -- it   doesn't yet exist in her world.   To you, it's a simple tool. To   her, it's magic.
I suppose she might think so.
And how would she react to you?
I think... she would fear me.
Just as you fear me.
I do not fear you any longer.
Good. My people once lived in   caves, too. We learned to build   huts... and, later, to build ships   such as this one.
Perhaps some day my people will   travel above the sky...
Of that, I have absolutely no   doubt.
It's not the season for lightning.   It must be a warning...
scene: 84   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: We've had storms at this time of   year before.
scene: 84   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Not like this one...
scene: 84   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: It must mean something!       The Picard is angry with us. He   blames us for Palmer's escape.
scene: 84   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Liko -- we don't know that the   Overseer is responsible for this   storm...
scene: 84   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Will he also send floods? My wife   died in last year's floods -- will   we all die now?
scene: 84   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: We must find Nuria.
scene: 84   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Picard... you have shown me   wonders I could never have   imagined... and I am grateful   beyond words... but might I   request something for my people?
You are indeed a leader.
You have shown me such generosity;   I wish my people could share in   it.       Six Mintakans died in a flood last   winter. Four of them were   children.
Would you bring them back to life?
That is beyond my power.

Why? You restored Liko's life.   Did the six who died offend you   in some way?       Or have I offended you? Should   I have ordered the death of Troi?   Please -- if there is anything   I can do to change your mind...
I've failed to get through to you,   haven't I? Despite all my   efforts...
Nuria can't be found. No one   knows where she's gone.
scene: 87   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Hali! Any sign of Palmer or   Riker?
scene: 87   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: They've escaped us. We searched   everywhere.
scene: 87   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: What do we do now?
scene: 87   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: As the Picard wishes. Punish   those responsible.
scene: 87   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Nuria would not allow --
scene: 87   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Nuria isn't here -- and we can't   wait.
scene: 87   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Crusher to Picard. I think   we're going to lose Warren.
On my way.
I'm here, Mary.
Prepare two cc's of norep.
I'm sorry.
Picard?
You could not save her.
No.
You do have limits. You are not   masters of life and death.

No, we are not.       We can cure many diseases and   repair many injuries. We can   extend life... but despite all   our knowledge -- all our advances   -- we are just as mortal as you   are... just as powerless to   prevent the inevitable.
You are a remarkable people. But   you are not superior beings.       My people must be made to   understand that.
Liko -- you don't want to kill   me.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: I have no choice. I must do as   the Picard wishes.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Are you sure you know what he   wants?
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: (after a beat; to the     others)   That's one problem with believing   in a supernatural being... trying   to determine what he wants.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: We must do something.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: But what if we do the wrong thing?
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Picard. We need your guidance.   Is it your wish that this woman   should die?       Answer us! Speak!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Liko!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: The Picard! The Overseer has   come!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: No, Liko -- I am not the Overseer.   I am a man... a traveller from   a faraway land. Nothing more.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: But you restored my life! I am   your servant.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: You are no one's servant. I   deserve neither your obedience   nor your worship.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Why are you trying to deceive me?
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Picard speaks the truth. I've   visited his people... I've seen   how they live... how they die.   When death takes their loved ones,   they are as helpless as we are.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Then how was I brought back to   life?
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: You were not dead. Picard's   people have knowledge we lack --   they can heal wounds that we   cannot.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: You can bring people back from   the dead. Show them, Picard.   You can bring my wife back to me.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: I can't.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Why? Why won't you do this for   me? Have I failed you somehow?   Are you angry with me?
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: I am not angry.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Then I beg you -- bring her back   to life!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: I will give you my life in   exchange! Please -- take back   what you've given me -- and give   it to her! Let her live!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: It is beyond my power.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Nothing is beyond your power!   You are the Overseer -- I'll   prove it!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Liko!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Go ahead, Liko. If I am   all-powerful, you can't hurt me.       If, however, I am telling the   truth and I am mortal... you will   kill me.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: But if the only proof you will   believe is my life -- then shoot.
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Don't do it, Liko!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Father -- no!
scene: 94   INT. MINTAKA THREE - ASSEMBLY HALL - NIGHT

quote: Captain's log, supplemental.   Before we dismantle the   observation post and depart, I   must make one last visit to   Mintaka Three.
Now, Mister La Forge.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: What is it?
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: A place where we could watch your   people.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Why?
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: To study you. To understand your   ways.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Why should a people so advanced   want to learn about us?
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Because we were once as you are.   To study you is to understand   ourselves.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: But why did you have to hide from   us?
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Because their presence would   affect us... as it affected me.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: It is our highest law that we   shall not interfere with other   cultures.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Then revealing yourselves was an   accident.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Yes. And now we must leave.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Why? There's so much you could   teach us...
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: But that would also be   interfering. You must progress   on your own.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: As we will. You've shown us   that nothing is beyond our reach.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Not even the stars.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I wish you good journeys, Picard.   Remember my people.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Always.
scene: 103  EXT. MINTAKA THREE - DUCK BLIND - DAY (OPTICAL)
